title: Britain's Got More Talent axed after 12 years - but fans are trying to save it
text:
Stephen Mulhern’s fan fave spin-off has been given the axe(Picture: Rex)

Britain’s Got More Talent is being cancelled after 12 years on the air – and fans are already petitioning to save it.

The ITV bosses have reportedly axed the ITV2 spin-off to Britain’s Got Talent to turn their focus onto social media videos instead.

BGMT has been hosted by Stephen Mulhern since it first launched in 2007, and sees unseen clips from the main series, as well as games with the judges and contestants.

‘Stephen is a much-loved member of the BGT family and everyone loved him on the show,’ a source told The Sun.

‘Behind the scenes, executives decided it was the right time to move on,’ they continued.

‘As our 18-34 audience share continues to grow and viewing habits are changing, naturally we are listening to our viewers and focusing more on digital platforms in support of the main show,’ a spokesperson for the show confirmed.

A #SaveBGMT hashtag has already been launched by fans of the series online in the wake of the news, with viewers furious that the much-loved series is coming to an end.

In fact, they’re even threatening to boycott the main show in protest.

‘Is this a joke? bgmt is hands down the most hilarious spin-off show and a big reason as to why I continue watching bgt in the first place. A very bad move :( #saveBGMT,’ one wrote.

While another was worried about their rapping fix and added: ‘Ok but like I can’t go without Stephens raps every year don’t let this happen #SaveBGMT’

‘Stephen and the crew are brilliant. moving it online would be a huge mistake. it works too well as a TV format for it to even be considered to go online only,’ said a third, adding: ‘Simon cowell’s just worried as the main show is going downhill the same way as the x factor. #SaveBGMT’

‘BGMT is one of the funniest shows on TV, it genuinely makes me laugh out loud. I often look forward to it more than the main show,’ another added.

‘Given its success, I can’t understand the decision to axe it. I am gutted #SaveBGMT’
